intro: Umbilicus alpestris, commonly known as the alpine umbilicus, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, often resembling a umbilical cord, hence its scientific name. It thrives in rocky, alpine environments and is adapted to cold climates. Umbilicus alpestris is often found in meadows and grasslands at high altitudes.
